assetDescriptions.description:
"DASHING THROUGH THE SQUARE"
"BLACK FRIDAY SPECIAL"

Need a reason to wear your favorite holiday gear? We’ve got one!

Join in the excitement of our “Dashing through the Square 5K” Race through historic Marietta, GA

Can't make it to Marietta, GA? Don't worry, we've got you covered! Virtual attendees have 2 registration options to choose from.

This year's event includes a 5K Walk/Run, a Virtual 5K and the 1K Rudolph Run.  The race is a Peachtree Qualifying Race and features electronic chip timing to ensure accuracy for all runners.  This family friendly race will take you past beautiful, historic homes and the quaint shops that line Marietta Square.  Proceeds from this event will support youth enrichment programs and other community initiatives benefiting Cobb County.

This race is sponsored by The PEARL Foundation, Inc. and Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc. – Rho Zeta Omega Chapter.

ABOUT THE CAUSE

The PEARL Foundation, Inc. is a 501(c)3 non-profit philanthropic arm of the Rho Zeta Omega Chapter. Its mission is to improve the quality of life for Georgians by providing education initiatives that promote self-reliance, self-empowerment, and self-determination. The Foundation sponsors programs that impact the lives of elementary, middle and high school students, as well as senior citizens in the community. For more information on The PEARL Foundation, Inc., visit www.thepearlfounationga.org.

Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc. is the first Greek-letter organization founded by African-American women at Howard University in 1908.  Led by our 29th President, Dorothy Buckhanan Wilson, Alpha Kappa Alpha is a sisterhood of national and international stature. Its members share the same high moral, ethical, scholastic, and spiritual standards; and are leaders in their community – inspiring, serving, and empowering all with whom they come in contact, while addressing the social and economic ills of our society. For more information about Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc., visit our websites at www.aka1908.com or www.akarhozetaomega.org.  Rho Zeta Omega Chapter was chartered in 1988 and serves the North Atlanta and Cobb County communities.

Frequently Asked Questions - See below

Event details and schedule

| COURSE | Begins and ends at the Marietta Square.  This family friendly race will take you past beautiful, historic homes and the quaint shops that line Marietta Square.  The race will be held rain or shine.
| WHAT’S INCLUDED | All 5K race participants will receive a high-quality runner's t-shirt and a commemorative medal (T-shirt is optional for Virtual 5K participants).  Special medals will be presented to 1st, 2nd & 3rd place finishers in the following age groups: 18-30, 31-50, 51 & above.
| WHAT TO WEAR | Be creative!! Show your holiday spirit by dressing in festive attire.
| TIME | Pre-Race Warm Up - 7:40 AM / 5K Walk/Run START TIME - 8:08 AM / 1K Rudolph Run - 9:50 AM

| PRICING | 

5K BLACK FRIDAY Registraltion: $25.00 (November 25 & 26 2016)

5K General Registration: $30.00 (ends November 26, 2016)
Virtual Race Registration (Medal Only): $30.00 (+ $3.95 Shipping FEE)
Virtual Race Registration (Medal + Shirt) $40 (+ $5.95 Shipping FEE)
1K Rudolph Race Registration: $10.00 (ends November 26, 2016)
| RACE DAY REGISTRATION | You may register on race day at Marietta Square from 6:30 - 7:30 a.m.

5K Race Day Registration - $40.00* / 1K Race Day Registration: $15.00

        *T-shirt and medal while supplies last
| PACKET PICKUP | December 1, 2016 - 4 PM to 8 PM at Big Peach Running Company, 1625 Ridenour Blvd., Kennesaw, GA 30152

| DIRECTIONS| From I-75, go West on North Marietta Parkway (Exit 265).  Continue to Church Street and take a left which will take you to the Square

| PARKING | Parking will be in the Cobb County Parking Deck and in available lots around the Square.  There is no charge for parking on the weekends.
| FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS|

1. What is a virtual race? ​A virtual race can be run or walked anytime and anywhere, even indoors on a treadmill.

2. Where do I submit my race results? You can submit your race results and pictures to - dashingthroughthesquare5k@gmail.com

3. Who can participate in a virtual race? Anyone! Young or old, fast or slow – we encourage participants of all ages and ability levels.

 4.How do I track my distance and time my runs? We accept results on the honor system, so you can track your distance and time however you like. The most accurate way to do this is by using a Running GPS watch, but there are also several free smartphone apps available for iPhones and Android devices that you may be interested in. Feel free to submit pictures of your race!!

5. When will I receive my medal? All races must be completed by January 3, 2016. Once you submit your race time and distance you will receive your medal within 7 business days to the address that you provided.

6. What happens if I cannot complete my run during the race period? Life happens, and we understand. Please contact us at dashingthroughthesquare5k@gmail.com if this should occur.

Spread the word to your family and friends!

The 8th Annual Marietta Mardi Gras 5K Fun Run & Walk will bring the Mardi Gras celebration to Marietta Square.  Register for a Timed or Untimed 5k, 1k or Tot Trot. This event is hosted by the Junior League of Cobb-Marietta.  Proceeds from this race benefit the mission of the Junior League Cobb-Marietta - promoting volunteerism, developing the potential of women and improving the community through the effective action of trained volunteers.

Event details and schedule

RACE SCHEDULE:

6:30am - Raceday Registration & Race Number Pick-up 

8:00am - 5K Run/Walk start

9:00am - 1K Fun Run/Walk start

9:15am - Tot Trot start

RACE REGISTRATION:

Online registration through Wednesday, Febuary 8th at midnight.

Mail-in registration should be postmarked by Saturday, February 4th, and sent to:  Marietta Mardi Gras 5K

                        c/o:  Racing Solutions

                        PO Box 468206

                        Atlanta, GA  31146

TEAM REGISTRATION:

Create a team of 10 or more participants, and receive a 10% discount for all participants.  This is a great way to save a couple of dollars, and have fun with your friends, family and/or an organization you are involved with.

RACE NUMBER PICK-UP:

Participants are encouraged to pick up their race number in advance at the Big Peach Running Company store in Kennesaw ONLY on Thursday, February 9th from 3:00pm to 8:00pm.  Participants may also pick-up their race number on the morning of the race at the race site at Marietta Square.  Race number pick-up will begin at 6:45am through the start of each race.

 

RACE T-SHIRTS:

All participants who register for the race byJanuary 31st are guaranteed a race T-shirt.  If you register after this date,we may not be able to guarantee the size T-shirt you request on race day.

Race Results & Awards:

Race results for the 5K can be used as a Peachtree Qualifier.  Race results will be available through Marietta5KRun.com or Active.com immediately after the race.

Awards will be presented on race day immediately following the 5K in the following categories:  Male & Female Overall and Masters winners; and the top three M/F finishers in age groups 10 & under, 11 to 14, 15 to 19, 20 to 24, 25 to 29, 30 to 34, 35 to 39, 40 to 44, 45 to 49, 50 to 54, 55 to 59, 60 to 64, 65 to 69 and 70 & over.  1K and Trot Trot participants will receive finisher ribbons.

Additional awards for Best Costume and Most Team Spirit.

RACE PARKING:

Parking is available at several parking lots surrounding Marietta Square and the government buildings adjacent to the square.  Please obey any posted parking regulations where you elect to park.

assetDescriptions.description:
The 16th Annual Sleighblells on the Square 5k is Peachtree Qualifying Race and USATF ceritified, sponsored by the Cobb County Bar Association.  A festive run for everyone as we raise money for the Children's Emergency Fund. The Children's Emergency Fund assists Cobb County School District and Marietta City Schools students and their families with emergency financial needs.

All participants will receive a long sleeve technical performance shirt. Jingle bells on shoes encouraged!

The course begins and ends at the Marietta Square. Participants will proceed through historic Marietta neighborhoods, returning to the Square for the award ceremony.  The race will be held rain or shine.

Schedule of Events:

7:00 Registration (10 E. Park Square)

8:30 am 5K

9:30 am 1k

9:45 am Tot Trot

9:50 am Awards

Directions: From I-75 go west on North Marietta Parkway (Exit 265). Continue to Church Street and take a left (just before the bridge) heading to the Square.

Parking: Parking will be in the Cobb County Parking Deck and in lots around the Square. There is no fee for parking on the weekends. 

Packet Pickup:

THURSDAY, DECEMBER 8, 2016

 

12 NOON- 6:00 PM

 

BIG PEACH RUNNING

 

1625 Ridenour Boulevard, Kennesaw, GA 30152

 

(678) 903-0022

 

 

 

FRIDAY, DECEMBER 9, 2016

 

11:00 AM- 7:00 PM

 

DICK’S SPORTING GOODS

 

Town Center Commons, 691 Ernest W Barrett Pkwy NW, Kennesaw, GA 30144

 

(770) 281-0200

assetDescriptions.description:
Come support the Wonderful Days Preschool, Inc, a pre-K program for low-income children. In operation since 1974, WDP is tuition-free, serves 2 nutritious meals daily, and provides transportation at no charge. Graduates speak fluent English. Alumni enter public kindergarten with enhanced intellectual development and prosocial values.

For your entry fee you'll get a great race shirt with original art from the kids at Wonderful Days and the awards are handmade by the children also.

Plenty of great food and plenty of prize drawings!

 

Packet pickup/late registration at St James Episcopal Church beginning at 6:30 a.m. on race day.

Event details and schedule

assetDescriptions.description:
Miles-4-Major is a non-profit organization that aims to raise awareness and financial support for families of hearing impaired children through family-centered outreach events such as the Annual Miles-4-Major 5K Race.

Event details and schedule

The race course consists of rolling hills winding through historic Marietta. Great course for runners, joggers, and walkers. Strollers and dogs welcome!

All 5K participants will receive a T-shirt and goodie bag. Trophies for the first overall male/female. Awards for top 3 runners in each division: 10 & under, 11-14, 15-19, 20-24, 25-29, 30-34, 35-39, 40-44, 45-49, 50-54, 55-59, 60-64, 65-69, 70+

Packet pickup will be at Big Peach Running Company Kennesaw Friday, March 24th from 4-7 PM.

Start a new holiday tradition and run the Lights of Life! The 5K run starts at 5pm (Just before Sunset) and takes in the beautiful campus of Life University during their annual holiday light show! After the run, stay and enjoy the holiday festivities, with caroling, s'mores and hot cocoa, an ugly sweater contest, food and music, and much more, including the Lights of Life!

Event details and schedule

5K starts at 5pm with the 1K starting at 430pm. Race starts and finishes on the track at Life University. Parking is available on campus and is FREE, but you can only enter the parking area from Life's Way (this road is accessible via Cobb Parkway). 

GET $5 BACK ON REGISTRATION (5K RUNNERS ONLY)!!! Bring an unwrapped toy when you pick up your bib # and get $5 back on the spot! All toys will be donated to the Boys and Girls Clubs of Cobb County to be given to needy children in Cobb County!! 

TEAM REGISTRATION IS AVAILABLE THIS YEAR! And we will have prizes for the most spirited team, and the best team name! 

Dress up in your favorite holiday costume for a chance to win cool prizes, and don'tforget to stay after the run to enjoy the Lights at Life! Bring the whole family, and start a new holiday tradition!

1K Fun Run SUNDAY (12/4) - Individual Age group/open

results.assetName: Run the Lights of Life 5K/1K Presented by Life University

assetDescriptions.description:
It's time to chase moonlight.... and race sunlight! The 5K in Paradise starts at 1am on the night Daylight Savings Time changes, giving you 1 hour to beat the time change. Finish the run to a tropical paradise complete with live palm trees, fruity drinks and beach music! Finishers will get a cool moon medal and our legendary pajama pants (they will be lightweight to get you ready for warm weather!!)

Don't want to stay up late?? Come race sunlight! We will have a SECOND race at 8am, where you can race sunlight with the same tropical fun! Finishers will get a shirt that matches the pajama pants and a groovy sun medal! 

OR TAKE THE DOUBLE DARE!! Run BOTH races for a great price, and score DOUBLE the swag! TWO medals, pajama pants, matching shirt.... and bragging rights that you knocked out both 5K's and beat the sun and moon!!

 

Event details and schedule

Parking is adjacent the start at Town Center Mall in Kennesaw and is FREE! If you do both races, you can hang out overnight with us - we will have music, food, and more!

Chasing Moonlight starts at 1am

Racing Sunlight starts at 8am

assetComponents.assetName: CHASING MOONLIGHT 5K (1AM START) - 5k NIGHT Run/Walk (1am start)
RACING SUNLIGHT 5K (8AM START) - Individual Age group/open

results.assetName: Chasing Moonlight / Racing Sunlight, the 5K in Paradise!

assetDescriptions.description:
This is the crown jewel of the Locomotive Race Series! Long Sleeve shirts, custom finisher medals and FREE pasta party for half marathoners! Two amazing courses that both finish to a huge post party that includes a FREE pancake breakfast thanks to our friends at First Watch!

Half Marathoners get a long sleeve shirt, FREE pasta party the night before, and custom finisher medal! 5K participants get a short sleeve shirt.

SEE BELOW FOR THE COURSE MAPS. PACKET PICKUP INFO, ETC.

Event details and schedule

Half Marathon starts at 730am, 5K at 8am. ROADS CLOSE AT 7AM AROUND THE VENUE SO PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY!

Plenty of FREE parking on site at the start at Barrett Summit! 

The 5K course is flat and fast, and the half is relatively flat in the first third, rolling in the second third, and relatively flat in the last third. BOTH courses are USATF certified! There are 8 water/powerade stops on the course as well as portojohns at the midpoint. 

The cutoff time is 3 hours for the Half Marathon; there is no cutoff for the 5K.

Stick around for a really fun post party with a holiday twist! (And of course a FREE pancake breakfast!)

 

PACKET PICKUP OPTIONS! 

 You have two options;

-The official packet pickup/pasta party and pre race fun will be at Highlands Grill in Kennesaw. The fun will be from 3-7pm (pasta party 4-7pm) on Saturday, December 10th. We will have some really good sale items on merchandise, etc. on site, and also a chance to register for the 2017 Locomotive Race Series package! (Race Day packet pickup will begin at 630am at the start)

- Race Day at the start beginning at 630am. 

 

COURSE MAPS

5K

results.assetName: The Locomotive Half Marathon / 5K (Presented by First Watch)

assetDescriptions.description:
Be the Change 5k is an event for overseas, Haiti Missions. There is so much opportunity for us to be the good we want to see in our world. Help us reach out to communities in Haiti who need our hands and feet to make a change. Your help is a vital part of this mission. 

Event details and schedule

Be the Change 5k is a run for Haiti Missions. Held on the campus of Kennesaw United Methodist Church, this is a family-friendly, out and back event. It will take participants through the surrounding neighborhood, past Pine Tree Country Club and back to the campus. Parking is available on the campus. Packet pickup begins at 7 am. The 5k will begin at 8:30 and the Fun Run is at 9:30! This is a rain or shine event! Weather may be unpredictable, so keep some layers in your car! There is so much opportunity for us to be the good we want to see in our world. Help us reach out to communities in Haiti who need our hands and feet to make a change. Your help and prayers are very appreciated!!
